Title: Data Analyst
CleanedDescription:
getchoice! is looking for a full-time data analyst to assist in ongoing data operational responsibilities. the data analyst will be responsible for accurately entering data from invoices into the company's application system. the ideal candidate will have excellent attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
key responsibilities:
accurately enter data from invoices into the application system
review and verify data to ensure accuracy and completeness
identify and resolve any discrepancies in the data
work with internal departments and external vendors to resolve invoice issues
maintain accurate records of all invoices and supporting documentation
assist with month-end closing and other financial reporting tasks as needed
contribute to process improvements to increase efficiency and accuracy
adhere to company policies and procedures related to reporting and data privacy
qualifications:
bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or related field preferred
strong attention to detail and accuracy
ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously
excellent communication skills, both verbal and written
proficiency in microsoft office, particularly excel
knowledge of accounting principles and practices preferred, but not required
familiarity with financial systems and software preferred, but not required
prior experience in invoice entry or data entry preferred, but not required
this is an entry-level position, and training will be provided. the successful candidate will have the opportunity to learn and grow within the organization.

Title: Data Analyst
CleanedDescription:
job summary: we are looking for flexible individuals who have a passion for data and get a thrill from analyzing customer data to identify trends, segments, opportunities, and actionable insights to increase engagement and revenue across the business.
job location – louisville, ky (in office)
essential functions:
work with marketing, finance, and product teams to understand, document, and analyze business needs and translate requirements into analytic and reporting solutions
assist in the design of analytic solutions. create and support the implementation of analytics, reports, and dashboards for business partners
conduct validation and testing of reports, dashboards, and analytics to ensure consistent and accurate reporting across the organization
develop insights to provide recommendations to business partners
support ongoing reporting processes.
required skills/abilities:
excellent verbal and written communication skills.
proficient in microsoft office suite or related software.
organizational skills with attention to detail.
ability to analyze and address needs of users.
self-motivated and able to multi-task, coordinate, and prioritize concurrent tasks

supervisory responsibilities:
none
education and/or experience:

experience in developing dashboards and reports in a bi tool (microstrategy strongly preferred)
ideal candidate will possess a passion for data discovery and analysis
background in designing and implementing complex and visually compelling reports and dashboards

physical demands: the following physical and mental demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
while performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, sometimes for prolonged periods while working at a desk, on the phone, and/or on the computer; type on a computer keyboard; use hands to finger, handle or feel; talk or hear; reach with hands or arms; walk or stand; and perform some repetitive motion activities.
specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, color differentiation, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
this position requires the ability to work effectively as part of a team; and concentrate on a variety of details when faced with interruptions and changing work priorities.
the mental demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions, as described above, including but not limited to: demonstrated ability to anticipate and solve practical problems or resolve issues; reason, calculate figures and amounts; collect, interpret, and/or analyze complex data and information, and draw valid conclusions; interpret procedures and policies; and meet schedules in a dynamic and sometimes demanding work environment.
the noise level in this work environment is usually moderate. the work environment characteristics are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job in a typical office environment.

Title: Data Analyst
CleanedDescription:
we are looking for a healthcare data analyst to gather and analyze healthcare data from multiple sources (. insurance processing, clinical operations, patient behavior) to extract trends and business insights. to succeed in this role, you should be analytical and resourceful. you should also be an excellent communicator who’s able to tell the story behind raw data to non-technical audiences. if you also have experience in the healthcare industry, we’d like to meet you. your goal will be to help us operate profitably and streamline our processes to keep patients and employees satisfied.
responsibilities
understand health care operations and systems
pull and integrate data from disparate sources (. cost and claims or clinical data)
create and validate record-keeping processes
delve into data to discover discrepancies and patterns
build models that capture a wide range of health care operations
present and explain information in an accessible way ( budgeting reports)
suggest ways to both increase healthcare quality and reduce costs (. money spent in r&d)
collaborate with management and internal teams to implement and evaluate improvements
requirements
proven experience as a healthcare data analyst
experience in data analysis and visualization methods
knowledge of extract, transform and load (etl) frameworks
proficient in sql and analysis tools (. sas)
knowledge of enterprise data warehouse (edw) and data management systems
excellent analytical and communication skills
outstanding organizational and problem-solving aptitude
bsc/ba in health informatics, statistics, mathematics or a related field
benefits
retirement plan (401k, ira)
life insurance (basic, voluntary & ad&d)
paid time off (vacation, sick & public holidays)
family leave (maternity, paternity)
short term & long term disability
training & development
work from home
wellness resources

Title: Airport Data Analyst
CleanedDescription:
summary statement
business is booming at the boise airport! to keep pace with the growth of our city and meet the demands of our community, the airport is undergoing a multi-million-dollar capital expansion plan to accommodate future transportation needs.
the boise airport is hiring a highly motivated and detail-oriented data analyst to organize and summarize discrete, continuous, and spatial data to produce data-driven products as the airport continues to grow and expand. the ideal candidate should be able to work independently, make fact-based decisions, and be comfortable with finding innovative solutions to complex problems. this position typically works 4 days remotely and 1 day at the airport each week.
provides the airport with detailed, meaningful analytics to support data-driven decisions across airport departments
develops and executes business strategies through a better understanding of airport data
presents airport data to advise organization leaders and is integral in guiding department work plans based on key metrics and analyses
work requires considerable independent judgment and initiative without established guidelines and procedures
develops airport analytics to anticipate needs and support department work plans. applies analytical methods to business problems, driving improved decision making and outcomes. moves the organization away from reactionary services to discover root causes and meet true underlying needs.
dissects and summarizes information with visually compelling charts and graphs to achieve understanding at all levels of the organization. effectively presents and articulates findings to key stakeholders digitally, in person and in written forms. critically evaluates information from multiple sources and systems using data mining, data queries and extraction to reconcile conflicting or incomplete data, creating a consistent set of tools. develops dashboards and reports to measure and project airport data and promotes and trains on use of self-service tools and technologies. translates data into succinct, actionable business insights and develops a holistic story. interprets and explains the implications of data on the business and provides recommendations for action to drive organizational performance improvement. publishes standard and complex ad-hoc reports with varying detail for different audiences.
manages and executes analytics projects from start to finish. performs complex analysis on existing data to generate statistics, discover correlating information, solve problems or make recommendations. analyzes issues, prepares recommendations based on findings and makes or recommends decisions that have a significant impact on general business operations or finances. applies analytical methods to business problems and conducts regular updates to forecasts and reports.
serves as the department’s point of contact for data requests and ad hoc reporting. completes data driven reports and requests for the airport community, other airports, organizations, regulators, and other stakeholders. produces cartographic products and tabular summaries. provides strategic level recommendations based on data and analytical outputs and methods. responds to a variety of reporting requirements. maintains working knowledge of area-specific systems technology and report writing, as well as internal policies and procedures. compiles, analyzes and presents technical and statistical information in reports. prepares written and oral reports requiring skills in research and analysis of statistical data, field studies and surveys.
identifies goals, objectives and business requirements with internal customers using interviews, requirements workshops, surveys, process descriptions, task and workflow analyses and communicates findings and recommendations to city staff, elected officials and the public through engaging data visualization and presentation. creates and curates interactive maps and dashboards, datasets and other data storytelling tools for use by the public to share information and increase the city’s data transparency. interprets and explains the implications of data on business operations.
develops and tracks performance measurement frameworks, key performance indicators (kpis) and goals and objectives to evaluate and manage performance. works with internal customers to create, analyze, and deploy ongoing activities related to performance measurement and continuous improvement. assists with identifying areas of improvements and concerns in strategic and operational areas and provides appropriate strategies to resolve them; identifies and designs solutions where multiple data sources and tools are often required. develops strong, credible partnerships and learns all aspects of the business for positive impact.
performs other duties as assigned. nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this position at any time.
requirements
required knowledge, experience, and training
bachelor's degree in computer science, business administration, or related field, and
3 years of experience with data management and visualization, or
an equivalent combination of education and/or experience
ability to
communicate effectively in the english language at a level necessary for efficient job performance
perform all essential functions as assigned by an authorized employee, supervisor and/or manager with or without reasonable accommodation
individuals must be capable of operating vehicles safely and have an acceptable driving record
preferred knowledge, experience, and training
master's degree in business, economics, statistics, or related field, and
5 years of progressive experience applying analytical methods to business problems, driving improved decision-making and outcomes
knowledge and experience with advanced bi tools, excel vba coding, sql or other database queries
licensing and other requirements
valid state-issued driver's license.
special requirements
applicants must be able to pass:
city of boise background check processes which includes a criminal history check and reference checks in accordance with the city of boise hiring process regulation
driving record check
transportation security administration background check (sida)
working conditions
the physical effort characteristics and working environment described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
physical efforts
while performing the duties of this job the employee is frequently lifting/carrying up to 10 pounds. also, the employee is frequently pushing/pulling up to 10 pounds. the noise level is rarely moderate. work includes sensory ability to talk and hear. work in this position also includes close vision. employees will sit, reach and grasp. position requires hand/finger dexterity.
working environment
the work environment will include inside conditions. employees will also drive a vehicle as part of this position.

Title: Data Analyst
CleanedDescription:
what we offer
interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide standardized reports and analysis. create effective presentations to convert information into knowledge. learn the intricacies of each project execution environment/technologies that dematic supports and identify opportunities for project execution improvements. support data architecture design efforts ensuring accurate representation of departmental data to the rest of the enterprise. ability to cleanse data and identify anomalies that may not reflect actual process outcomes. convert data into meaningful charts, tables, and reports to communicate potential root causes of quote process challenges or sales process anomalies. extrapolate data results to represent anticipated future needs. collaborate with project/execution management team to align data analysis with expectations and ensure alignment. develop junior analysts’ data capabilities and validate competency.
tasks and qualifications
requires a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, data science or closely related field and 2 years’ experience as a data analyst, business intelligence analyst, data scientist, or closely related occupation. also requires 1 year of experience with dematic’s quoting systems including maestro, qma, pqr, and salesforce; connecting data between those quoting systems to provide insights to management; analyzing data and presenting data with modern tools including database languages (sql, python, or other), microsoft power suite, and visualization tools (tableau, power bi, or other). approximately 10% travel required to various unanticipated locations. pre-employment processing for this position requires drug testing and passing background checks. located at dematic corp. in plano, tx, but telecommuting is permitted. apply online at /careers req # jr-0047418
the base pay range for this role is estimated to be $82,000 - $166,000 at the time of posting. final compensation will be determined by various factors such as work location, education, experience, knowledge, and skills.

Title: Data Analyst, 203QE
CleanedDescription:
about quartus
quartus engineering incorporated () is a leading provider of engineering services and integrated hardware solutions for a wide range of clients and industries. we employ advanced computer-aided engineering tools in the areas of optics, structural, thermal, and coupled analyses. we couple our engineering analysis capabilities with design, prototype, integration and test capabilities to create solutions for our clients that are of extraordinary value.
 what will you do?
as a data analyst in our san diego, ca office you will be highly involved with the design, development and administration of the data infrastructure that is used to lead quartus engineering’s business analytics initiatives. the data analyst will be responsible for meeting with business leaders to gather requirements, retrieve data from applicable data sources and clean/prepare data for ingestion into a data warehouse that can be used to build dashboards with bi tools such as powerbi or tableau. use data to gain insights into business opportunities.
essential job functions
responsible for developing and maintaining data analytics infrastructure to support business strategic initiatives
performs comprehensive analysis of source system data and data within the data warehouse to meet client business needs.
build and maintain dashboards and reports with appropriate kpi’s and metrics to support business requirements
work with erp and other core system to manage flow of data into database for analytical reporting and forecasting
develop plans for all stages of business analysis types such as descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive
build, manage and maintain data warehouse with appropriate tools such as sql
meet frequently with stakeholders to review and analyze data inconsistencies to resolve in a timely fashion
location
position is based in san diego, ca with a hybrid schedule.
what are we looking for?
bs degree computer science, mathematics or related field required
3+ years of experience with business analytics
advanced knowledge with analytic tools such as sql, python, r, powerbi, tableau, excel, etc.
experience with creating dashboards, reports and visualizations to help business leaders better understand inefficiencies, trends and forecasting
experience with linux and hpc
experience with project management
self-motivated, goal oriented and a team player
strong written and communication skills
experienced leading people and groups both direct and indirect reports
compensation and benefits
data analyst pay range: $32.25/hour – $52.69/hour*
this pay range represents base pay. in addition, you may be eligible for additional benefits and compensation.
executive order 14042 directs government contractors and subcontractors to provide covid-19 safety protocols for all employees working on or in connection with a federal government contract.  these safety protocols include, among other requirements, a vaccine mandate requiring full vaccination for employees of covered federal contractors, with limited exceptions for those legally entitled to an accommodation. as a government contractor, we require all employees to (a) establish that they have been fully vaccinated; or (b) obtain an approved exemption as an accommodation. any offer from the company is contingent upon you meeting this requirement prior to starting your employment.

Title: CIN Data Analyst - CIN * Days - 40hrs/wk
CleanedDescription:
requisition #: req6689
shift: days
fte status: 1
on-call: no
weekends: no
looking for someone with proficiency in sql and ssrs.
general summary
the cin data analyst supports the metro health integrated network (mhin) data strategy and operations by providing analytical and data management support to the mhin staff and membership. this position provides support by managing the integration of internal and external data from various sources and conducts audits to ensure quality, completeness, consistency, and timeliness of data sources. as part of the analytics team, the cin data analyst supports the strategies and initiatives of mhin. this position works closely with cin and metro health it staff to initiate, monitor, and maintain open data requests to ensure requests are completed on time. this position generates standard reporting and insightful analysis relating to payer and network initiatives.
requirements
bachelor’s degree in business, healthcare administration or related field, or commensurate experience.
1-3 years of data analysis experience required; previous health care insurance industry strongly preferred.
previous experience in data management including the collection, organization, and validation of multiple data sources.
strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills, to enable effective interaction with staff, customers, and other key stakeholders, required.
previous experience in the design and development of reports; identifying trends, potential problems and issues to support the organizations efforts in medical management.
strong project management skills, with ability to prioritize multiple projects in relation to the organization’s strategic objectives.
self-motivated, creative problem solver who can work independently and collaborate through strong communication and interpersonal skills.
excellent attention to detail with good time management skills.
excellent knowledge and use of existing software packages. proficient with analysis in excel.
essential functions and responsibilities
support the organizational efforts related to low to moderately-complex data quality and analysis.
serve as a liaison between cin and metro health it to translate operational needs into data requests and reporting specifications.
initiate, monitor, and maintain data and reporting requests in coordination with metro health bi/ba department.
integrate data from internal and external data sources or functional areas, ensures data accuracy and integrity, and updates data as needed. develop a thorough understanding of data sources used within the department, including how the data is obtained/stored, appropriate use for the data from different information sources, complexities involved with certain types of data, and how to validate different types of data.
manage the incoming and outgoing data from payers and external entities as necessary.
conduct data audits to ensure quality, completeness, consistency, and timeliness of data. identifies and addresses data quality issues with the necessary stakeholders.
data acquisition, data analysis, report development, data monitoring, and maintenance of quality and utilization data from both internal and external sources.
reconcile external data with cin sources and work to resolve any discrepancies.
generate standard weekly/quarterly/monthly reports as assigned and provide accurate, timely and insightful analysis in response to ad hoc management requests and issues.
proactively work cross-functionally within the cin analytic team to meet organizational objectives.
performs other duties as assigned. these may include but are not limited to: maintaining a current knowledge base of department processes, protocols and procedures, pursuing self-directed learning and continuing education opportunities, and participating on committees, task forces, and work groups as determined by management.

Title: Data Analyst
CleanedDescription:
summary of job duties and responsibilities
this position constructs complex queries used to create reports and predictive models. this job integrates data in relational databases such as tableau, microsoft access and other business objects. responsibility for federal and state reporting is inherent with substantial work for institutional surveys for internal, state and federal agencies.
compile, coordinate, and report official institutional data to federal and state agencies as well as other internal and external constituencies.
use statistical techniques for reports with use of algorithms and computer code for needed reports.
routinely discusses gaps in programming specifications with supervisor, information systems and other offices, as appropriate.
extract, combine, and/or compare data as needed to produce ad hoc or scheduled reports for decision support purposes.
performs maintenance on existing reports to ensure data is available for institutional effectiveness for colleagues’ work responsibilities.
collaborate and organize reports for internal and external data requests.
coordinate enrollment, retention, graduation data and financial information necessary for performance funding projects.
serve as the main contact and developer for completion of internal and external surveys.
assist with work needs for the director of institutional research as it relates to requests from administration, faculty and staff.
support the work associated with ipeds and serve in a role to assist in the ipeds keyholder position.
perform other duties as assigned or needed.
employees of the office of institutional effectiveness must comply with all rules and regulations per the higher education act ( hea ), as disaggregated student data may be received in order to complete title iv reports which are required for institutional purposes. this position has a legitimate educational interest in the disclosed information, and the data must be handled with the highest level of confidentiality. all fafsa data will be de-identified, if required for other institutional reporting purposes.

Title: Data Analyst II - Remote | Hybrid
CleanedDescription:
are you ready to be part of a team that's changing the health industry for the better? we're looking for a data analyst ii to join us at a national healthcare organization with 26 million members. as part of our team, you'll have access to a wide range of competitive benefits, including flexible work options, paid time off, health insurance coverage, 401(k) plans, and tuition reimbursement.
as a data analyst ii, you'll be responsible for managing complex data requests and reports, including predictive data modeling. you'll work on analyzing health management programs, including data collection, validation, and outcome measurement. this may involve analyzing financial, pharmacy, claims, provider, and member data, as well as irs, cms, hhsc, and hedis reporting. you'll also be responsible for internal data cleansing and data reconciliation analysis, trend analysis, and generating reports through ms-excel, ms-access, and sql using business objects interface and direct links to core databases (ods/edw).
in addition to your analytical duties, you'll also be expected to gather and interpret business requirements, monitor data trends to proactively identify issues, execute data changes and update core systems as needed, and handle multiple projects and timelines effectively. you'll also assist with training lower level data analysts.
to be successful in this role, you should have a bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience, as well as 2+ years of statistical analysis or data analysis experience. you should also have advanced knowledge of business objects, sql, and microsoft applications, including excel and access.
at our company, we're committed to diversity and value the ways in which we are different. we're an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.
if you're excited about this opportunity, please apply to our data analyst ii position, located in various locations throughout florida. we can't wait to hear from you!
employment type: full-time
salary: $ 60,000.00 120,000.00 per year

Title: REMOTE - Insights Analyst
CleanedDescription:
description
job name: insights analyst
summary
job grade:
huntington distribution finance is seeking a insights analyst to join the business insights team. this individual will participate in all phases of the data and analytics lifecycle, including specifying data capture requirements, analyzing patterns and trends in structured and unstructured data that span across all facets of the business and synthesize findings into presentations that convey insights and recommendations through storytelling, while maintaining a balance between the big picture and mastery of details.
job responsibilities
apply visualization techniques to internal and external data sources to make accurate and actionable analyses in a timely fashion

Title: Business Intelligence Coordinator
CleanedDescription:
in order to be considered for this role, after clicking "apply now" above and being redirected, you must fully complete the application process on the follow-up screen.
about the position
as part of the business analytics team, the business intelligence coordinator will be responsible for supporting the creation, management, auditing, and troubleshooting of business intelligence data workflows. they will play a critical role in supporting the reporting efforts of the team and will assist in some data analysis projects.
key responsibilities
ensure data quality and accuracy across existing reports
provide support to analytics team in converting existing reports to new data sources and updating data sources as data sets change, ensuring continued accurate reporting & visualization in our internal systems.
assist our analysts in creation of new data visualizations, leading to better understanding of our data
work with data architecture area of team to automate workflows with the goal of alleviating manual pulling of data for visualization, and exposing data to appropriate areas of the business
assist with updating & cleaning data sets – this will require some level of manual loading of data, with the goal of working towards standardization and automation where possible.
required experience & skills
bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, other related field, or equivalent work experience
proficient in microsoft office (word, excel, outlook, powerpoint), experience with advanced excel data functionality such as vlookup, pivot tables, & solver
experience with data visualization tools and techniques, preferably with tableau
strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable and profitable opportunities for the business
must possess effective verbal and written communication skills
strong interpersonal skills with the ability to establish working relationships with individuals at varying levels within the organization
strong attention to detail and ability to find errors in data
ability to adapt to new situations and learn quickly
desired skills
1-2 years of experience working with data and constructing data visualizations
proficient in sql, preferably ssms (sql server management studio)
position type/expected hours of work
this is a full-time position. must be able to work flexible hours including some evenings, weekends, and occasional holidays.
this position will work at our headquarters, crosscountry mortgage campus, in berea, ohio

Title: Product Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
CleanedDescription:
we are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated product data analyst to join our team! as a key member of our digital transformation project, you will play an integral role in onboarding our product data into our plm system from various data sources. the successful candidate will have excellent data management skills and be able to work independently.
this is a remote position with a leading consumer products company. we offer a fantastic work environment, as well as competitive pay and benefits, including hourly pay of $29/hr, group medical, dental, vision, life, retirement savings program, and w2 employment.
as a product data analyst, you will be responsible for migrating product data into excel spreadsheets and collaborating with engineers to locate missing data. you will also work with edt resources to create and adjust excel templates and upload engineering bills of materials into our plm system. additionally, you will perform data cleanup work in our plm system and direct work for uploading new data.
the ideal candidate will have an associate degree or higher, data management expertise, and experience with plm and sap systems. change management and cpgs experience is desired, as well as strong computer skills, including a working knowledge of the microsoft office suite of products, with a particular emphasis on excel. you should be able to analyze data from multiple sources and drive accurate data to be communicated to outside sources.
if you're passionate about data management and excited to be a part of a team that is driving digital transformation, then we would love to hear from you!
employment type: full-time
salary: $ 29.00 per hour

Title: Sales Data Analyst
CleanedDescription:
as a data analyst you’ll complete data analysis, data mining, pattern analysis, data visualization, reporting, and data management. day-to-day responsibilities will include deep dive analyses on sales data, preparing a multitude of reporting materials, crm (salesforce) management and process improvement, as well as a variety of ad-hoc projects. you will deliver insights, review and develop metrics to dive into the largest and most complex data across the enterprise to answer the most difficult questions that are foundational to driving real-world value by offering deep insight into every aspect of the business.
in this role, you will have the opportunity to be involved in the most essential strategic efforts to provide analytic thought leadership that drives a data-grounded perspective to help access think critically and differently about all aspects of our business to improve our core capabilities.
primary responsibility
mine large structured and unstructured data appropriately to derive actionable insights and make recommendations on how the data can be used to help solve business problems
create data visualizations to help business leaders understand their business problems/trends and the proposed solutions
translate data analysis to guide business decisions
partner and regularly communicate and work with the business and technical teams
collaborate with cross-functional teams to create insights from data to be presented to clients.
actively develop and adhere to quality assurance best practices for data science services across the organization.
conduct research and make recommendations on machine learning tools, techniques, and technologies in support of development efforts
assist in ad-hoc projects and requests from business leaders
support in the preparation of various monthly sales materials
education and experience
bachelor's degree in a highly quantitative field (., statistics, computer science, engineering, physics, math, operations research, etc.)
3-5 years’ experience in data science
sound programming and database experience using python or r, & sql at a minimum
experience building visualizations and kpi dashboards with tools such as tableau, qlikview, or grafana
experience in salesforce analytics and power bi
statistical skills utilized in a/b testing, analyzing observational data, and modeling a plus
salary: $100,000 - $110,000 annually

Title: Data & Analytics Analyst (REMOTE OPPORTUNITY)
CleanedDescription:
talentify helps candidates around the world to discover and stay focused on the jobs they want until they can complete a full application in the hiring company career page/ats.
regions is dedicated to taking appropriate steps to safeguard and protect private and personally identifiable information you submit. the information that you submit will be collected and reviewed by associates, consultants, and vendors of regions in order to evaluate your qualifications and experience for job opportunities and will not be used for marketing purposes, sold, or shared outside of regions unless required by law. such information will be stored in accordance with regulatory requirements and in conjunction with regions’ retention schedule for a minimum of three years. you may review, modify, or update your information by visiting and logging into the careers section of the system.
job description
at regions, the data and analytics analyst transforms data into a meaningful format for operational and/or decision-making purposes. focusing on day-to-day deliverables, this role works with senior analysts and managers to gather and interpret data for leaders to make data-driven decisions.
primary responsibilities
modifies reports that are valuable, readable, and presentable to stakeholders
assists in the preparation of visual reports/presentations to present analysis to management
interprets, analyzes, and provides insights to teams and managers to determine operational impact, trends, and opportunities
performs data analysis to help achieve data automation
creates and maintains databases to help classify & store information
completes day-to-day deliverables and ad-hoc data reports to support business needs/projects and answer data related questions
ensures compliance by performing quality data audits, mining, and management
monitors data and analytics trends and seeks opportunities for continuous improvement
may offer guidance to junior analysts, ensuring proper training and tools are provided
partners with the centralized data governance team to implement and support data governance and data quality requirements
this position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the fair labor standards act and is not eligible for overtime pay.
requirements
master's degree in business, computer science, information systems, finance, statistics, or related field and two (2) years of experience in a data analytics or related role
or, a bachelor’s degree in business, computer science, information systems, finance, statistics, or related field and four (4) years of experience in a data analytics or related role
preferences
experience utilizing analytical software such as structured query language (sql), statistical analysis system (sas), sas enterprise miner, and applicable microsoft office applications
working knowledge of business intelligence software (. tableau, power bi)
skills and competencies
demonstrated leadership capabilities
proficiency in microsoft office (excel, word, powerpoint, outlook, etc.)
strong verbal, written communication, and organizational skills
strong work ethic and self-motivation
this position may be filled at a higher level depending on the candidate’s qualifications and relevant experience.
position type
full time

Title: Claims Data Analyst II - (Open To Remote)
CleanedDescription:
this position is responsible for using tools such as sql, gcp and looker studio to identify, define and employ an analytical strategy to proactively and reactively investigate business data.
compensation minimum:$58,900 annual
compensation maximum:$88,400 annual
compensation may vary based on the job level and your geographic work location.
essential job responsibilities
claims data analyst will create, deliver, and support custom data products, as well as enhance/expand team capabilities. they will work on analyzing and manipulating large datasets supporting the enterprise by activating data driven strategy.
creates and maintains complex spreadsheets, dashboards, and database queries. performs trend analysis and produces various reports as determined by management.
strategically mines claims, policy, vendor, and industry data to identify patterns and insights which could enable process improvement opportunities. additionally, develop workflows to confirm suspicious trends as it relates to operations and organized insurance fraud.
supports the research, analysis, and presentation of information by producing reports, compiling, and summarizing information, producing supporting documentation and exhibits, and verifying information received from external sources.
develops, produces, and maintains custom and ad hoc reports. analyzes information contained in reports as requested or needed. uses various data tools to pull information and create reports.
utilizes exception analysis to audit data, identify and trace faulty information to its source. proactively and independently works to get information corrected.
analyze daily, weekly, and monthly reports and presents findings to management. maintains compliance with internal audit reporting.
assists other associates with preparation of reports and use of information systems, software, and related sources of information. trains other users on report preparation, report usage, and database access.
collaborates extensively with the claims and product organizations. comprehensively cross trains with other analysts to fully support all team functions.
participates and leads special projects and teams.
completes special projects as assigned by business management.
performs other duties as assigned.
experience/skills requirements
strong experience building complex sql queries, prior experience working in big query.
experience with dashboarding and visualization tools such as tableau and looker studio.
prior experience using alteryx or python is a plus.
three-five years data analysis experience required.
leadership/training/supervisory experience a plus.
one-two years of automobile insurance experience, non-standard insurance industry, claim processing, and/or siu preferred.
ability to provide oral and written communication regarding claims issues to various departments and levels of management.
works well both independently, and within a team environment.
ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, and works well under pressure.
excellent verbal, written, presentation, and interpersonal skills expected.
ability to build strong relationship across the organization required.
education requirements
bachelor’s degree in business, information systems, statistics, mathematics, economics, data science, or related field is preferred.
we provide benefits that support your physical, emotional, and financial wellbeing. you will have access to comprehensive medical, dental, vision and wellbeing benefits that enable you to take care of your health. we also offer a competitive 401(k) contribution, a pension plan, an annual incentive, 9 paid holidays and a paid time off program (23 days accrued annually for full-time employees). in addition, our student loan repayment program and paid-family leave are available to support our employees and their families. interns and contingent workers are not eligible for american family insurance group benefits.
we are an equal opportunity employer. it is our policy to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws pertaining to non-discrimination, non-harassment and equal opportunity. we also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

Title: Data Steward Analyst Jr
CleanedDescription:
id de trabajo 23631043 ubicación primaria ciudad de méxico, méxico; categoría de trabajo technology
the data steward analyst jr is a developing professional role. applies specialty area knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. identifies policy gaps and formulates policies. interprets data and makes recommendations. researches and interprets factual information. identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.
responsibilities
facilitate and review data governance programs, principles, policy, practices, and standards including industry best practices with data governance leads and managers.
prepare materials for monthly operating reviews (mors), portfolio reviews, horizontal meetings, town halls and staff meetings.
perform analysis of dq issues and deliver metrics reporting.
support managers with status reports and presentation content. guide data analysis and reporting processes that include collection from multiple sources, validation of data and assembly and presentation of required data.
develop new data collection and evaluation methodologies, including format design, data compilation, relevancy and metrics.
liaise with other citi risk organizations to determine and maintain appropriate alignment, specifically with citi data standards.
appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
qualifications
1-2 years banking or financial services experience
demonstrated influencing, facilitation and partnering skills
analytical, flexible, team-oriented and have good interpersonal/communication skills.
passion and good skills working with data.
good attitude facing new challenges.
education
bachelor’s/university degree or equivalent experience
